trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage
trans-unit.target: Move Data to and from Azure Blob Storage

trans-unit.source: This topic describes three methods to move data to and from Azure Blob storage:
trans-unit.target: This topic describes three methods to move data to and from Azure Blob storage:

trans-unit.source: Using Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Using Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: Using AzCopy Command line utility
trans-unit.target: Using AzCopy Command line utility

trans-unit.source: Using Azure SDK in Python
trans-unit.target: Using Azure SDK in Python

trans-unit.source: Which method is best for you will depend on your scenario.
trans-unit.target: Which method is best for you will depend on your scenario.

trans-unit.source: The [Scenarios for the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) in Azure Machine Learning](../machine-learning-data-science-plan-sample-scenarios.md) article helps you determine the resources you need for a variety of data science workflows used in the advanced analytics process.
trans-unit.target: The [Scenarios for the Advanced Analytics Process and Technology (ADAPT) in Azure Machine Learning](../machine-learning-data-science-plan-sample-scenarios.md) article helps you determine the resources you need for a variety of data science workflows used in the advanced analytics process.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] As an alternative, you can use [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/data-factory/) to create and schedule a pipeline that will download data from Azure blob storage, pass it to a published Azure Machine Learning web service, receive the predictive analytics results, and upload the results to storage.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] As an alternative, you can use [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/data-factory/) to create and schedule a pipeline that will download data from Azure blob storage, pass it to a published Azure Machine Learning web service, receive the predictive analytics results, and upload the results to storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Create predictive pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning](../data-factory/data-factory-create-predictive-pipelines.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Create predictive pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Machine Learning](../data-factory/data-factory-create-predictive-pipelines.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For a complete introduction to Azure blob storage, please refer to [Azure Blob Basics](../storage-dotnet-how-to-use-blobs.md) and [Azure Blob Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179376.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: Before uploading/downloading data, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on getting this information, see the "How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys" section of [Manage storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on getting this information, see the "How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys" section of [Manage storage accounts](../storage-create-storage-account.md).

trans-unit.source: This document assumes that you have an Azure storage account and the corresponding storage key(s).
trans-unit.target: This document assumes that you have an Azure storage account and the corresponding storage key(s).

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer is a free windows based tool for inspecting and altering data in an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer is a free windows based tool for inspecting and altering data in an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: It can be downloaded from [Azure Storage Explorer](http://azurestorageexplorer.codeplex.com/).
trans-unit.target: It can be downloaded from [Azure Storage Explorer](http://azurestorageexplorer.codeplex.com/).

trans-unit.source: The following steps document how to upload/download data using Azure Storage Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The following steps document how to upload/download data using Azure Storage Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Launch Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: Launch Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: If the storage account you want to access has not been added to Azure Storage Explorer, click the "Add Account" button to add the account.
trans-unit.target: If the storage account you want to access has not been added to Azure Storage Explorer, click the "Add Account" button to add the account.

trans-unit.source: If it has already been added, select the account from the "--Select a Storage Account--" dropdown.
trans-unit.target: If it has already been added, select the account from the "--Select a Storage Account--" dropdown.

trans-unit.source: ![Create workspace][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Create workspace][1]

trans-unit.source: Enter storage account name and storage account key, and then click Add Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: Enter storage account name and storage account key, and then click Add Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: You may add multiple storage accounts and each account will be displayed on a tab.
trans-unit.target: You may add multiple storage accounts and each account will be displayed on a tab.

trans-unit.source: The containers under this storage account are shown in the left panel.
trans-unit.target: The containers under this storage account are shown in the left panel.

trans-unit.source: Select a container to see the blobs in the container in the right panel.
trans-unit.target: Select a container to see the blobs in the container in the right panel.

trans-unit.source: ![Create workspace][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Create workspace][2]

trans-unit.source: ![Create workspace][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Create workspace][3]

trans-unit.source: Upload data by clicking the "Upload" button.
trans-unit.target: Upload data by clicking the "Upload" button.

trans-unit.source: Select one or multiple files to upload from the file system and click "Open" to begin uploading the file(s).
trans-unit.target: Select one or multiple files to upload from the file system and click "Open" to begin uploading the file(s).

trans-unit.source: Download data by selecting the blob in the corresponding container and clicking the "Download" button .
trans-unit.target: Download data by selecting the blob in the corresponding container and clicking the "Download" button .

trans-unit.source: Use AzCopy
trans-unit.target: Use AzCopy

trans-unit.source: AzCopy is a command line utility to upload and download data.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy is a command line utility to upload and download data.

trans-unit.source: **Warning** If you are using a machine different from the VM that was set up earlier in the advanced analytics process, please install AzCopy using the following installation instructions: [Download and install AzCopy](../storage-use-azcopy.md#install).
trans-unit.target: **Warning** If you are using a machine different from the VM that was set up earlier in the advanced analytics process, please install AzCopy using the following installation instructions: [Download and install AzCopy](../storage-use-azcopy.md#install).

trans-unit.source: Examples of uploading/downloading files to/from blobs:
trans-unit.target: Examples of uploading/downloading files to/from blobs:

trans-unit.source: When uploading files, /S will upload files recursively.
trans-unit.target: When uploading files, /S will upload files recursively.

trans-unit.source: Without this parameter, any files in the subdirectory will not be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Without this parameter, any files in the subdirectory will not be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: When downloading file, /S will search the container recursively until all files in the specified directory and its subdirectories or all files that matching the specified pattern in the given directory and its subdirectories, are downloaded.
trans-unit.target: When downloading file, /S will search the container recursively until all files in the specified directory and its subdirectories or all files that matching the specified pattern in the given directory and its subdirectories, are downloaded.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify a specific blob file to download using the /Source parameter.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify a specific blob file to download using the /Source parameter.

trans-unit.source: To download a specific file, specify the blob file name to download using the /Pattern parameter.
trans-unit.target: To download a specific file, specify the blob file name to download using the /Pattern parameter.

trans-unit.source: /S parameter can be used to have AzCopy look for a file name pattern recursively.
trans-unit.target: /S parameter can be used to have AzCopy look for a file name pattern recursively.

trans-unit.source: Without the pattern parameter, AzCopy will download all files in that directory.
trans-unit.target: Without the pattern parameter, AzCopy will download all files in that directory.

trans-unit.source: For detailed usage of AzCopy, please refer to [Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility](../storage-use-azcopy.md#install).
trans-unit.target: For detailed usage of AzCopy, please refer to [Getting Started with the AzCopy Command-Line Utility](../storage-use-azcopy.md#install).

trans-unit.target: Use Python

trans-unit.target: List the blobs in a container

trans-unit.source: This section documents how to list, upload and download blobs.
trans-unit.target: This section documents how to list, upload and download blobs.

trans-unit.source: For more details of the usage of the Python API, please refer [How to Use the Blob Storage Service from Python](../storage-python-how-to-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more details of the usage of the Python API, please refer [How to Use the Blob Storage Service from Python](../storage-python-how-to-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using a machine different from the VM that was set up earlier in the advanced analytics process, you need to install the [Python Azure SDK](../python-how-to-install.md) before using the sample code below.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using a machine different from the VM that was set up earlier in the advanced analytics process, you need to install the [Python Azure SDK](../python-how-to-install.md) before using the sample code below.

trans-unit.source: Upload Data to Blob
trans-unit.target: Upload Data to Blob

trans-unit.source: Add the following snippet near the top of any Python code in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: Add the following snippet near the top of any Python code in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The **BlobService** object lets you work with containers and blobs.
trans-unit.target: The **BlobService** object lets you work with containers and blobs.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a BlobService object using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace account name and account key with your real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace account name and account key with your real account and key.

trans-unit.source: Use the following methods to upload data to a blob:
trans-unit.target: Use the following methods to upload data to a blob:

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path (uploads the contents of a file from the specified path)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_path (uploads the contents of a file from the specified path)

trans-unit.source: put\_block_blob\_from\_file (uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream)
trans-unit.target: put\_block_blob\_from\_file (uploads the contents from an already opened file/stream)

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes (uploads an array of bytes)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_bytes (uploads an array of bytes)

trans-unit.source: put\_block\_blob\_from\_text (uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding)
trans-unit.target: put\_block\_blob\_from\_text (uploads the specified text value using the specified encoding)
